FuncDef:
The traffic-policy-action car disable command disables the CAR function in a traffic policy in VXLAN mode on a specified board.
The undo traffic-policy-action car disable command cancels the configuration.
By default, CAR in a traffic policy in VXLAN mode is effective on all supported boards.
CLIs: traffic-policy-action car disable [ exclude ] slot <slotid> vxlan-mode
undo traffic-policy-action car disable [ exclude ] slot <slotid> vxlan-mode

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that the specified boards are excluded.
-

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
When a traffic policy in VXLAN mode is configured in the BD/VPN view for packets entering or exiting a VXLAN tunnel and contains a CAR action, to disable the CAR function in the traffic policy on a specified board or on boards excluding specified ones, run the traffic-policy-action car disable command.
Prerequisites
A CAR-capable traffic policy in VXLAN has been configured in the BD/VPN view.
Precautions
This command can disable the CAR function only in unshared traffic policies in VXLAN mode. The configurations in the same view must all contain exclude or not.
